name: Pick Up (Master Pose)
description:
National Contest of Prototypes XXII 2020

This game is registered as a prototype in the National Contest of Prototypes XXII 2020 that is done annually for all the institutes of the DGETI at México.

  • Click any cell to go there.
  • Click in a cell with trash to pick it up (you can only pick one at a time).
  • With trash in your inventory, select the correct container to leave it there.
  • Press ESC to return to the Menu.
  • On the menu, go to the credits (with the "question mark" button) and there you can change the background music.
  • Press E three times to delete all the progress.

One of the digital medias more attractive to young people are videogames,  as they allow them to live the adventures of a protagonist as their own and althought this is wonderful because it allows the growth of the creativity of the young people, they are also the causes of distractions. There have been many discussions on banning them but, what about using them in our favor? Regrettably in our contry (México) the didactic use that they have has not been studied so much, but now it's the time,  time to transform an element used normally for leisure and entertaiment to a tool that brings lessons to our futures generations, that brings them valuable knowledge.

The use of  videogames in pedagogical ways is possible and it's one of the better ways of teaching.

If you're a programmer, game developer, designer, influencer or any type of content creator, let's demostrate that digital medias aren't malicious! join the cause and start making educational content for futures generations.

You don't know how to code? doesn't matter, there are plenty of ways you can make videogames without coding, for example this game, made with Construct 2.
